Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
•
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
IF CONTRACTED
Please note that violations of any licensing rules are also violations of the MISEP and
your contract.

INVESTIGATION:
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126 Sufficiency of Staff
Section
Description The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative rules
and in the agency’s program statement and to provide for the continual
needs, protection, and supervision of residents.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation Sexual contact occurred between two residents while in the presence of
a staff member.
Investigation I reviewed intake dated 01/24/2023. It states Youth A and B live in a
hospital for sex offenders and that Staff Person 1 was supervising the
group on 01/20/2023. Youth A and B were sitting next to each other at
2

their own table. Staff Person 1 suspected inappropriate behavior
between the two and approached. It was discovered that Youth A had
his penis out of his pants though under his shirt and asked Youth B if
he wanted to touch it. Youth B touched Youth A’s penis and then Youth
A asked if he could touch Youth B’s penis which he stated “yes”. Youth
A then touched Youth B’s penis which was also out of his pants though
under his shirt. The touching between Youth A and B was consensual.
Youth A and B have been separated and when their restrictions are
completed will not be in groups together.
I interviewed Complainant onsite on 01/24/2023. She reports no other
concerns other than what was noted in the intake. She states the
facility program is for youth who are sexual offenders. She states it is
an unwritten policy that no two youth are to be sitting side-by-side
which is discussed with staff during training. The incident noted
occurred during free time in classroom B with approximately five to
seven youths being supervised by Staff Person 1 and that the staff to
resident ratio capacity is one staff to eight youths. It is reported that
Youth A has been in his current placement for two plus years and that
Youth B has been placed for five months.
I interviewed Youth A onsite on 01/24/2023. He reports bringing out his
penis from his pants and covering it with his shirt and that Youth B
touched it, and that Youth B then did the same. He states the
exchange lasted a couple minutes before Staff Person 1 exclaimed,
“Hey, what’s going on?” and approached the two. Youth A states that
residents are not allowed to sit next to each other, and that Staff Person
1 did not stop them from sitting next to each other. Youth A states he
has received restrictions and has been separated from Youth B.
I interviewed Youth B onsite on 01/24/2023. He reports sitting at the
table with Youth A sitting next to him and that Youth A asked if Youth B
liked him which he stated that he did. He reports Youth A had pulled
his penis out from his pants though under his shirt and asked if he
wanted to touch it which Youth B states he did. Youth B denies pulling
out his own penis. He then reports Staff Person 1 called out his name
and approached he and Youth A when they got up and walked around
the classroom. Youth B reports he received restrictions and has been
separated from Youth A.
I interviewed Staff Person 1 via telephone on 01/24/2023. She reports
being employed by the facility for three months, received orientation,
and has no disciplinary actions on her. She notes the youth placed at
the facility are sexual offenders requiring close supervision. She recalls
being positioned in the center of the classroom and saw everyone
noting that she could see all youth’s hands. She states one youth was
4

pushing the desks together to create a large table and that Youth A and
B were sitting next to each other though in separate desks which were
approximately two and a half feet apart. She does not recall observing
Youth A and B as they initially sat down though. Staff Person 1 states
that after approximately one minute of noticing Youth A and B sitting
next to each other that she observed Youth A’s arm move quickly away.
She recalls standing up to approach and asking Youths A and B what
was going on. She then states Youths A and B also stood up and
walked away from the desks as well, and that Supervisor eventually
came in and spoke with both youths separately. Staff Person 1 states
initially being told during training not to have residents sit side-by-side,
and notes that sometimes they do while playing games, though a space
between youth usually occurs. Staff Person 1 states that Youth A and
B were sitting in separate desks, though placed next to each other, and
that she did not consider this arrangement as sitting side-by-side. She
states that it would not appear to be comfortable attempting to touch
someone in another desk. Staff Person 1 states she relies on others
and the supervisors to let her know if what she is doing is okay.
I interviewed Supervisor onsite on 01/24/2023. She reports not being
witness to the incident or being in classroom B. Supervisor reports
observing Youth A in the hallway and Youth B “freaking out” inside the
classroom after the incident. She reports speaking with Youths A and
B in which it was discovered that the two were sitting next to each other
and touched each other’s exposed penis’. Supervisor states staff are
trained to not have residents sit next to each other though it is not a
written policy.
Video surveillance for the date of the incident was not able to be
accessed for review.
Analysis The facility had a sufficient number of direct care staff at time of the
incident involving Youths A and B. However, staff present did not
provide for the continual needs, protection, and supervision of the youth
in their sexual offender program by allowing the youths to sit side-by-
side. Staff involved reports being told during training not to have
residents sit side-by-side though did not consider sitting in separate
desks, next to each other, as sitting side-by-side. It is noted that
residents do on occasion sit next to each for game time though spaced
apart. It is recommended that the facility further clarify resident spacing
while sitting side-by-side during free time and structured gametime.
Conclusion Violation Established
4
